meanings.definition: To attempt to influence or pressure (someone) by talking in a forceful or aggressive way.
meanings.sent1: The coach was jawboning the players to give their best performance.
meanings.sent2: She was jawboning her colleagues to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jawboned the students into participating in the class activity.
meanings.sent4: The politician jawboned the crowd into supporting his campaign.
meanings.sent5: The boss's jawboning made the employees work harder to achieve the goal.

meanings.definition: The act of using persuasive or forceful talk to influence or pressure someone.
meanings.sent1: His jawboning during the negotiation was quite effective.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was partly due to the CEO's jawboning.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jawboning about dieting had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her jawboning in the meeting was like a powerful speech.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's jawboning inspired the students to work harder on their projects.
